title: Kaiviti Silktails
text:
The Kaiviti Silktails are a semi-professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> football club from <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a> and currently based in Sydney. They compete in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">NSWRL</a>'s <a href="Ron%20Massey%20Cup">Ron Massey Cup</a>, and will advance to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">Knock-On Effect(KOE) NSW Cup</a> in 2023. The Silktails will be a predominantly Under-23 side from 2022 onwards.
History.
The <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">NSWRL</a> had first endorsed a bid team from Fiji led by <a href="Petero%20Civoniceva">Petero Civoniceva</a> early in 2014 to have a team compete in the <a href="2016%20Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">2016 NSW Cup</a> competition. The bid received endorsement from the <a href="Fiji%20National%20Rugby%20League">Fiji National Rugby League</a> in 2018. In June 2019, it was announced that the Kaiviti Silktails would enter the <a href="Ron%20Massey%20Cup">Ron Massey Cup</a> in 2020, with promotion to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> in 2021. <a href="Brandon%20Costin">Brandon Costin</a>, coach of the <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Fijian national team</a>, was announced as head coach.
The Silktails won their opening match of the 2020 season 40–16 against the <a href="Windsor%20Wolves">Windsor Wolves</a> in Lautoka. The season was subsequently cancelled due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. <a href="Wes%20Naiqama">Wes Naiqama</a> was named head coach in June 2020.
The Silktails remained in the Ron Massey Cup in 2021, remaining in Australia for the duration of the season due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>, and playing their home matches at <a href="Mascot%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Mascot Oval</a>. During their round 1 <a href="bye%20%28sports%29">bye</a>, the team played a trial match against the <a href="Mascot%20Jets">Mascot Jets</a>, winning 46–16. Their round 2 match against the <a href="Blacktown%20Workers%20Sea%20Eagles">Blacktown Workers Sea Eagles</a> was postponed due to <a href="2021%20Eastern%20Australia%20floods">inclement weather</a>.
Stadium.
The Silktails were scheduled to play all 10 of their home matches in 2020 at <a href="Churchill%20Park%2C%20Lautoka">Churchill Park</a>, <a href="Lautoka">Lautoka</a>. In 2021, the team will play all of their home matches at <a href="Mascot%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Mascot Oval</a>, <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>.
